summary: Study: Age-related muscle decline (sarcopenia) associates with numerous health risk factors and poor health quality of life . Age- related muscle decline associates with several health and well-being risk factors . The study was published at the University of Nottingham .

ZA delays sarcopenia, which translates to improved neuromuscular function across the life course . Bisphosphonates might, therefore, be an immediately exploitable anti-sarcopenia therapy .  C.C. sup>22: "C.A. C. A. C.'s" "C." is a reference

C. elegans muscle is morphologically and metabolically similar to human muscle and has high genetic orthology (60–85%) of sub-muscular systems with people . We employed  Caenorhabditis elegans as a genomic model of ageing muscle decline to establish the bone‐independent effects of bisphosphonates on sarcopenia progression .  Chips were stored in petri dishes at 20°C for the next 24 h with damp, sterile tissue and parafilmed to avoid the microfluidic arena drying out .
These lifespan-promoting ZA doses also associated with healthspan extension at 1 μM (AUC =963.1 ±48.74, P < > 0.05;  and .P: “The lifespan‐promoting

Zoledronic acid delayed age-related declines in muscle sarcomere and mitochondrial integrity . Animals exposed to ZA exhibit significant declines in survivability to untreated controls . ZA thus acts dose‐dependently to augment animal longevity and health across the life course .  Zoledronic acid decreased muscle cells categorized as ‘moderately disorganized’ on days 4 (17.0% vs. 38.2%) and 6 (27.6 vs. 53.4%) post-adulthood . Zoledronics acid reduced the number of ‘severely disorganized' muscles on day 6 post-ADulthood (

Zoledronic acid attenuates age-related loss of muscle mitochondrial structure . Treatment did not delay onset of well-networked mitochondria loss at day 2 post-adulthood . Zoledronics acid prevented progressive mitochondrial fragmentation at day 6 post-ADU .  The lifespan extending effects of Zoledronic acid have previously been attributed to the mevalonate cholesterol/isoprenoid lipid biosynthesis pathway and the FOXO family of transcription factors . Their role in ZA's healthspan extension is unknown .

Knockdown of <em>FDPS (FDPS) with ZA co-treatment (1 m) prevents ZA mediated lifespan (top) and healthspan (bottom) extension) Knockdown of <em>.daf‐16 (FOXO) decreases survival and movement, with no improvement with Za co‐treatment (B) The conserved bone‐mus  Knockdown of <em>igdb‐1 (FNDC5) significantly increased survival and healthspan . Mitochondrial sirtuins (SIRT3) and FGF21 (FGF21) displayed opposing effects; SIRT3 is dispensable for ZA's healthspan effects . SIRT4 knockdown increased survival, as did ZA co‐treatment

Bisposphonates (ZA) extend C. elegans' lifespan and healthspan, which associates with delayed onset of muscle sarcomere and mitochondrial decline . Identifying drugs in clinical use and repurposing for sarcopenia indications could provide exploitable pharmaceuticals for the general population .  A recent study in fruit flies suggests similar effects might extend to the ageing process . A recent research suggests bisphosphonate treatment prolonged lifespan and animal healthspan .

In fruit flies, bisphosphonates increase lifespan through inhibition of the mevalonate metabolic pathway and downstream FOXO activation . The dysfunction of the FOXO system is linked to wide ranging pathologies including cardiovascular disease, autoimmune disease, cancer and Alzheimer's disease . Knockdown of a key enzyme in mevalanate metabolism, farnesyl diphosphate synthetase The healthspan effects of igdb‐1 KD were also comparable with ZA co‐treatment . This could be interpreted as ZA exerting healthspan‐promoting inhibitory effects on igdb'1 or acting through independent pathways . Because C. elegans lack an endoskeleton, these findings espouse bone-independent mechanisms of bisph

Chronic bisphosphonate administration delays onset of muscle structural and mitochondrial decline in a C. elegans model of sarcopenia . This translates to improved animal health across the entire life course . Growing evidence thus suggests that bisph phosphosonates act at least partially through mitochondrial mechanisms to lessen the effects of SARS . Zoledronate extends health span and survival via the mevalonate pathway in a FOXO‐dependent manner .
The article is published in the journal Fphar. 2017 . It is published by the journal's publisher, the journal Nature Publishinghouse .
